H0.text: Jovian planets are the largest system of which Earth is only a very small part, as structures in the universe are grouped into large systems that are each made up of smaller systems.

H1.text: Halley's comet is the largest system of which Earth is only a very small part, as described in the question that structures in the universe are grouped into large systems each made up of smaller systems.

H2.text: The Milky Way galaxy is the largest system of which Earth is only a very small part, within the hierarchy of universal structures that are grouped into large systems made up of smaller systems.

H3.text: Orion's belt is the largest system in the universe in which Earth is only a very small part.

A4.text: The paper concludes that the Milky Way and Andromeda Galaxy were not overly large spiral galaxies, nor were among the largest known.

A5.text: The Milky Way contains 100â€“400 billion stars and at least that number of planets.

A6.text: The Local Group is the galaxy group that includes the Milky Way, where Earth is located.

A7.text: The Sun dominates the system by mass.

A8.text: The Kuiper belt is a great ring of debris similar to the asteroid belt, but consisting mainly of objects composed primarily of ice.

A9.text: Earth, along with the Solar System, is situated in the Milky Way and orbits about 28,000 light-years from its center.

A10.text: It is about 20 light-years above the galactic plane in the Orion Arm.
